trans-unit.source: This document will walk through a deployment that uses multiple NICs in VMs in a specific scenario.
trans-unit.target: This document will walk through a deployment that uses multiple NICs in VMs in a specific scenario.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, you have a two-tiered IaaS workload hosted in Azure.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, you have a two-tiered IaaS workload hosted in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Each tier is deployed in its own subnet in a virtual network (VNet).
trans-unit.target: Each tier is deployed in its own subnet in a virtual network (VNet).

trans-unit.source: The front end tier is composed of several web servers, grouped together in a load balancer set for high availability.
trans-unit.target: The front end tier is composed of several web servers, grouped together in a load balancer set for high availability.

trans-unit.source: The back end tier is composed of several database servers.
trans-unit.target: The back end tier is composed of several database servers.

trans-unit.source: These database servers will be deployed with two NICs each, one for database access, the other for management.
trans-unit.target: These database servers will be deployed with two NICs each, one for database access, the other for management.

trans-unit.source: The scenario also includes Network Security Groups (NSGs) to control what traffic is allowed to each subnet, and NIC in the deployment.
trans-unit.target: The scenario also includes Network Security Groups (NSGs) to control what traffic is allowed to each subnet, and NIC in the deployment.

trans-unit.source: The figure below shows the basic architecture of this scenario.
trans-unit.target: The figure below shows the basic architecture of this scenario.
